tit.e: Fujiwara Shikike (the Ceremonial House of the Fujiwara clan)
tit.cmt: 英語の補足を追加しました。
tit.e: Fujiwara Shikike (the Ceremonial House of the Fujiwara clan)

sen.j: 藤原式家（ふじわらしきけ）とは、右大臣藤原不比等の三男藤原宇合を祖とする家系。
sen.e: Fujiwara Shikike is a sub branch of Fujiwara family, started by FUJIWARA no Umakai, the third son of Udaijin (Minister of the Right) FUJIWARA no Fuhito.
Fujiwara Shikike is a sub branch of Fujiwara family, started by FUJIWARA no Umakai, the third son of Udaijin (Minister of the Right) FUJIWARA no Fuhito.
Fujiwara Shikike is a sub branch of Fujiwara family, started by FUJIWARA no Umakai, the third son of Udaijin (Minister of the Right) FUJIWARA no Fuhito.

sen.j: 宇合が式部卿を兼ねたことから式家と称した。
sen.e: The name of Shikike originated from the fact that Umakai was appointed as Shikibukyo (Minister of the Ministry of Ceremonial).
The name of Shikike originated from the fact that Umakai was appointed as Shikibukyo (Minister of the Ministry of Ceremonial).
The name of Shikike originated from the fact that Umakai was appointed as Shikibukyo (Minister of the Ministry of Ceremonial).

sen.j: 祖の宇合は長屋王の変の後参議に昇進し、藤原四兄弟たちと共に聖武天皇朝で政権を主導したが、天平9年（737年）の天然痘蔓延により病没してしまう。
sen.e: Umakai, founder of the Fujiwara Shikike, was promoted to sangi (councilor) after the Nagayao no Hen (Conspiracy of Nagayao) and led the government during Shomu Emperor's era with other brothers, but he died of smallpox which spread in 737.

Umakai, founder of the Fujiwara Shikike, was promoted to sangi (councilor) after the Conspiracy of Nagayao and led the government during the Emperor Shomu's era with other brothers, but he died of smallpox which spread in 737.

Umakai, founder of the Fujiwara Shikike, was promoted to sangi (councilor) after the Conspiracy of Nagayao and led the government during the Emperor Shomu's era with other brothers, but he died of smallpox which spread in 737.

sen.j: さらに直後に大宰少弐に左遷された宇合の長男藤原広嗣は天平12年（740年）九州にて反乱を起こしたが、敗死してしまった（藤原広嗣の乱）。
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Hirotsugu, eldest son of Umakai and was demoted to Dazai no shoni (Junior Assistant Governor-General of Dazai-fu offices) after his father's death, rose in revolt in Kyushu, known as the Rebellion of FUJIWARA no Hirotsugu in 740.

FUJIWARA no Hirotsugu, the eldest son of Umakai and was demoted to Dazai no shoni (Junior Assistant Governor-General of Dazai-fu offices) after his father's death, rose in revolt in Kyushu, known as the Rebellion of FUJIWARA no Hirotsugu in 740, but was killed in defeat.

FUJIWARA no Hirotsugu, the eldest son of Umakai and was demoted to Dazai no shoni (Junior Assistant Governor-General of Dazai-fu offices) after his father's death, rose in revolt in Kyushu, known as the Rebellion of FUJIWARA no Hirotsugu in 740, but was killed in defeat.

sen.j: この為孝謙天皇～称徳天皇朝にかけて、藤原南家（藤原豊成・藤原仲麻呂）や藤原北家（藤原永手）の後塵を許す時期がしばらく続いた。
sen.e: Due to these situations, Fujiwara Shikike had been subordinate to the so-called 'Southern House' of the Fujiwara clan, led by FUJIWARA no Toyonari and FUJIWARA no Nakamaro, as well as the 'Northern House' of the Fujiwara clan, led by FUJIWARA no Nagate, during the eras of Emperor Koken and Emperor Shotoku.

Due to these situations, Fujiwara Shikike had been subordinate to the so-called Fujiwara Nanke (Southern House of the Fujiwara clan) led by FUJIWARA no Toyonari and FUJIWARA no Nakamaro, as well as the Fujiwara Hokke (Northern House of the Fujiwara clan) led by FUJIWARA no Nagate, during the eras of Emperor Koken and Emperor Shotoku.
sen.cmt: 藤原南家、北家の読みを追加しました。
sen.e: Due to these situations, Fujiwara Shikike had been subordinate to the so-called Fujiwara Nanke (Southern House of the Fujiwara clan) led by FUJIWARA no Toyonari and FUJIWARA no Nakamaro, as well as the Fujiwara Hokke (Northern House of the Fujiwara clan) led by FUJIWARA no Nagate, during the eras of Emperor Koken and Emperor Shotoku.

sen.j: 広嗣の弟である藤原良継や藤原百川は称徳天皇の後継に光仁天皇を擁立することに成功し、道鏡・吉備真備に代わって政権の中枢に躍り出た。
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Yoshitsugu and FUJIWARA no Momokawa, younger brothers of Hirotsugu, were successful in helping Emperor Konin to succeed Emperor Shotoku, and rose in the heart of the government instead of Dokyo and KIBI no Makibi.

FUJIWARA no Yoshitsugu and FUJIWARA no Momokawa, younger brothers of Hirotsugu, were successful in helping Emperor Konin to succeed Emperor Shotoku, and rose in the heart of the government instead of Dokyo and KIBI no Makibi.

FUJIWARA no Yoshitsugu and FUJIWARA no Momokawa, younger brothers of Hirotsugu, were successful in helping Emperor Konin to succeed Emperor Shotoku, and rose in the heart of the government instead of Dokyo and KIBI no Makibi.

sen.j: また、彼らはそれぞれ自分の娘（藤原乙牟漏・藤原旅子）を皇太子山部親王（のちの桓武天皇）の妃とし後宮政策も行った。
sen.e: Yoshitsugu and Momokawa also each married their daughters, FUJIWARA no Otomuro and FUJIWARA no Tabiko, to Imperial Crown Prince Yamanobe (who later became Emperor Kammu) and directed Kokyu policy.

Yoshitsugu and Momokawa also each married their daughters, FUJIWARA no Otomuro and FUJIWARA no Tabiko, to Imperial Crown Prince Yamanobe (who later became Emperor Kanmu) and directed Kokyu (empress's residence) policies.
sen.cmt: 後宮 補足を追加しました。
sen.e: Yoshitsugu and Momokawa also each married their daughters, FUJIWARA no Otomuro and FUJIWARA no Tabiko, to Imperial Crown Prince Yamanobe (who later became Emperor Kanmu) and directed Kokyu (empress's residence) policies.

sen.j: 彼ら兄弟はいずれも桓武天皇の即位を見ないまま亡くなったが、乙牟漏は皇后となり平城天皇・嵯峨の両天皇を、旅子は淳和天皇を産み、平安時代初期の式家繁栄の礎を築いた。
sen.e: Both Yoshitsugu and Momokawa died before the enthronement of Emperor Kammu, but Otomuro became empress and gave birth to Emperor Heizei and Emperor Saga while Tabiko became mother of Emperor Junna, building the base of prosperity of the Fujiwara Shikike during the early Heian period.

Both Yoshitsugu and Momokawa died before the enthronement of Emperor Kanmu, but Otomuro became empress and gave birth to Emperor Heizei and Emperor Saga while Tabiko became mother of Emperor Junna, building the base of prosperity of the Fujiwara Shikike during the early Heian period.

Both Yoshitsugu and Momokawa died before the enthronement of Emperor Kanmu, but Otomuro became empress and gave birth to Emperor Heizei and Emperor Saga while Tabiko became mother of Emperor Junna, building the base of prosperity of the Fujiwara Shikike during the early Heian period.

sen.j: 桓武朝では式家一族は重用され、宇合四男の藤原田麻呂は事実上の臣下最高位であった左大臣にまで昇進し、三男藤原清成の子である藤原種継は長岡京造営の事業を一任されるなどした。
sen.e: During the Emperor Kammu period, family members of Fujiwara Shikike were appointed to important positions; FUJIWARA no Tamaro, the forth son of Umakai, was promoted to Sadaijin (Minister of the left) which was practically the highest position among vassals, while FUJIWARA no Tanetsugu, son of Umakai's third son FUJIWARA no Kiyonari, was in charge of building Nagaoka-kyo (Japan's short-lived eighth century capital).

During the Emperor Kanmu period, family members of Fujiwara Shikike were appointed to important positions; FUJIWARA no Tamaro, the forth son of Umakai, was promoted to Sadaijin (Minister of the left) which was practically the highest position among vassals, while FUJIWARA no Tanetsugu, son of Umakai's third son FUJIWARA no Kiyonari, was in charge of building Nagaoka-kyo (Japan's short-lived eighth century capital).

During the Emperor Kanmu period, family members of Fujiwara Shikike were appointed to important positions; FUJIWARA no Tamaro, the forth son of Umakai, was promoted to Sadaijin (Minister of the left) which was practically the highest position among vassals, while FUJIWARA no Tanetsugu, son of Umakai's third son FUJIWARA no Kiyonari, was in charge of building Nagaoka-kyo (Japan's short-lived eighth century capital).

sen.j: 百川の子で桓武天皇の義弟（姉の藤原旅子は天皇の女御）でもあった藤原緒嗣もわずか29歳で参議に昇進すると、長岡京の後に建設された平安京造宮と蝦夷征伐の中止を進言した。
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Otsugu, son of Momokawa and younger brother of FUJIWARA no Tabiko (nyogo of Emperor Kammu), took charge of building Heian-kyo (the ancient capital of Japan in current Kyoto) and proposed to suspend punitive expedition to Ezo after he was promoted to sangi at the age of 29.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Otsugu, son of Momokawa and younger brother of FUJIWARA no Tabiko (nyogo [a consort of an emperor]) of Emperor Kanmu), took charge of building Heian-kyo (the ancient capital of Japan in current Kyoto) and proposed to suspend punitive expedition to Ezo after he was promoted to sangi at the age of 29.

FUJIWARA no Otsugu, son of Momokawa and younger brother of FUJIWARA no Tabiko (nyogo [a consort of an emperor]) of Emperor Kanmu), took charge of building Heian-kyo (the ancient capital of Japan in current Kyoto) and proposed to suspend punitive expedition to Ezo after he was promoted to sangi at the age of 29.

sen.j: 平城朝においては観察使制度の設置等政治改革に積極的に取り組み、嵯峨朝を経て旅子を母とする淳和天皇が即位するとその外伯父として累進し、右大臣ついで左大臣に至った。
sen.e: During the Emperor Heizei era, FUJIWARA no Otsugu worked on political reforms, including establishment of the system of inspecting local governments, and rose to higher positions during the era of Emperor Junna (emperor after Saga) as uncle of Emperor (mother of Emperor Junna was FUJIWARA no Tabiko, sister of Otsugu), eventually was appointed to Udaijin (Minister of the Right) and Sadaijin (Minister of the Left) in a row.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: During the Emperor Heizei era, FUJIWARA no Otsugu worked on political reforms, including establishment of the system of inspecting local governments, and rose to higher positions during the era of Emperor Junna (emperor after Saga) as uncle of Emperor (mother of Emperor Junna was FUJIWARA no Tabiko, sister of Otsugu), eventually was appointed to Udaijin (Minister of the Right) and Sadaijin (Minister of the Left) in a row.
sen.cmt: 余分なスペースの削除
sen.e: During the Emperor Heizei era, FUJIWARA no Otsugu worked on political reforms, including establishment of the system of inspecting local governments, and rose to higher positions during the era of Emperor Junna (emperor after Saga) as uncle of Emperor (mother of Emperor Junna was FUJIWARA no Tabiko, sister of Otsugu), eventually was appointed to Udaijin (Minister of the Right) and Sadaijin (Minister of the Left) in a row.

sen.j: しかし、嵯峨朝以降式家は徐々に北家に圧倒されていくが、その一因として、良継の一人息子である藤原託美の事故死による、平城・嵯峨両天皇の外戚である良継系の断絶があった。
sen.e: Fujiwara Shikike gradually went under and was overwhelmed by Fujiwara Hokke after the era of Emperor Saga, partly due to the extinction of the Yoshitsugu family (maternal relatives to Emperor Heizei and Emperor Saga) caused by the death of FUJIWARA no Takumi, the only son of Yoshitsugu.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: However, Fujiwara Shikike gradually went under and was overwhelmed by Fujiwara Hokke after the era of Emperor Saga, partly due to the extinction of the Yoshitsugu family (maternal relatives to Emperor Heizei and Emperor Saga) caused by the death of FUJIWARA no Takumi, the only son of Yoshitsugu.

However, Fujiwara Shikike gradually went under and was overwhelmed by Fujiwara Hokke after the era of Emperor Saga, partly due to the extinction of the Yoshitsugu family (maternal relatives to Emperor Heizei and Emperor Saga) caused by the death of FUJIWARA no Takumi, the only son of Yoshitsugu.

sen.j: また、嵯峨朝になると、種継の子で平城天皇の内侍司として権勢を握った藤原薬子とその兄藤原仲成が反乱を企てて断罪された薬子の変の発生に加え、嵯峨天皇・橘嘉智子の信頼を受けた北家の冬嗣の台頭も背景にある。
sen.e: The Kusuko Incident, a failed rebellion by FUJIWARA no Nakanari and his sister Kusuko who held power as naishi no tsukasa (a female palace attendant) for Emperor Heizei, as well as rise of FUJIWARA no Fuyutsugu from Fujiwara Hokke who won trust of Emperor Saga and TACHIBANA no Kachiko also led to the decline of Shikike.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Furthermore, the Kusuko Incident, a failed rebellion by FUJIWARA no Nakanari and his sister Kusuko who was a daughter of Tanetsugu and held power as naishi no tsukasa (a female palace attendant) for Emperor Heizei, as well as the rise of FUJIWARA no Fuyutsugu from Fujiwara Hokke who won trust of Emperor Saga and TACHIBANA no Kachiko, also led to the decline of Shikike.
sen.cmt: 「種継の子である」を追加しました。
sen.e: Furthermore, the Kusuko Incident, a failed rebellion by FUJIWARA no Nakanari and his sister Kusuko who was a daughter of Tanetsugu and held power as naishi no tsukasa (a female palace attendant) for Emperor Heizei, as well as the rise of FUJIWARA no Fuyutsugu from Fujiwara Hokke who won trust of Emperor Saga and TACHIBANA no Kachiko, also led to the decline of Shikike.

sen.j: さらに、冬嗣の息子である藤原良房が嵯峨上皇の皇女源潔姫を降嫁されるなど、父同様上皇と皇太后に深く信任されたのに対し、緒嗣は長男の藤原家緒に先立たれる等、式家はその後有力な人材を出すことができなかった。
sen.e: Further, Hokke family won deep trust of the retired Emperor Saga and Empress Dowager, shown by the fact that Fuyutsugu's son, FUJIWARA no Yoshifusa, got married with MINAMOTO no Kiyohime, Imperial princess of the retired Emperor Saga, while Shikike family failed to produce influential figures due to incidents such as the death of FUJIWARA no Ieo, the eldest son of Otsugu.

In addition, Hokke family won deep trust of the Retired Emperor Saga and Empress Dowager, shown by the fact that Fuyutsugu's son, FUJIWARA no Yoshifusa, got married with MINAMOTO no Kiyohime, Imperial princess of the Retired Emperor Saga, while Shikike family failed to produce influential figures due to incidents such as the death of FUJIWARA no Ieo, the eldest son of Otsugu.

In addition, Hokke family won deep trust of the Retired Emperor Saga and Empress Dowager, shown by the fact that Fuyutsugu's son, FUJIWARA no Yoshifusa, got married with MINAMOTO no Kiyohime, Imperial princess of the Retired Emperor Saga, while Shikike family failed to produce influential figures due to incidents such as the death of FUJIWARA no Ieo, the eldest son of Otsugu.

sen.j: それでも、緒嗣は冬嗣の死後、淳和・仁明天皇朝において15年以上も台閣の首班の座を維持し、従兄弟甥にあたる藤原吉野も地方官として治績を挙げ、中納言に昇進した。
sen.e: Otsugu eventually maintained shuhan (the head seat) of Taikaku more than 15 years after the death of Fuyutsugu during the eras of Emperors Junna and Ninmyo, while his male cousin FUJIWARA no Yoshino also left accomplishments as a local office, and was promoted to Chunagon.

Otsugu still eventually maintained the head seat of Taikaku (cabinet) more than 15 years after the death of Fuyutsugu during the eras of Emperors Junna and Ninmyo, while his cousin's son FUJIWARA no Yoshino also left accomplishments as a local officer, and was promoted to Chunagon (vice-councilor of state).
sen.cmt: 台閣 補足を追加しました。従兄弟甥→ cousin's son としました。
sen.e: Otsugu still eventually maintained the head seat of Taikaku (cabinet) more than 15 years after the death of Fuyutsugu during the eras of Emperors Junna and Ninmyo, while his cousin's son FUJIWARA no Yoshino also left accomplishments as a local officer, and was promoted to Chunagon (vice-councilor of state).

sen.j: しかしながら、吉野は承和の変で失脚し、その直後には緒嗣が亡くなる等の条件も重なり、以後は式家が再び政治の中枢に立つ事は無くなった。
sen.e: However, Yoshino lost his position during the Jowa Incident, and right after the downfall of Yoshino, Otsugu died,
However, Yoshino lost his position during the Jowa Incident, and right after the downfall of Yoshino, Otsugu died, making Shikike step aside the center of the politics afterwards.
However, Yoshino lost his position during the Jowa Incident, and right after the downfall of Yoshino, Otsugu died, making Shikike step aside the center of the politics afterwards.

sen.j: その後は、藤原純友の乱を平定した藤原忠文や、阿衡事件に関与した藤原佐世等を輩出したものの、平安時代中期以降は儒学によって立身する家系として数家がしばらく血統を保つのみとなり、鎌倉時代まで続いた家はほとんどなかった。
sen.e: Thereafter, Fujiwara Shikike produced FUJIWARA no Tadabumi, who put down FUJIWARA no Sumitomo's War, and FUJIWARA no Sukeyo, who was involved with the Ako Incident, but from the middle of the Heian period, only a couple of families managed to keep their lines known as those rise on the basis of Confucianism, and few could remain until the Kamakura period.

Thereafter, Fujiwara Shikike produced FUJIWARA no Tadabumi, who put down FUJIWARA no Sumitomo's War, and FUJIWARA no Sukeyo, who was involved with the Ako Incident, but from the middle of the Heian period, only a couple of families managed to keep their lines known as those that rose on the basis of Confucianism, and few could remain until the Kamakura period.

Thereafter, Fujiwara Shikike produced FUJIWARA no Tadabumi, who put down FUJIWARA no Sumitomo's War, and FUJIWARA no Sukeyo, who was involved with the Ako Incident, but from the middle of the Heian period, only a couple of families managed to keep their lines known as those that rose on the basis of Confucianism, and few could remain until the Kamakura period.

sen.j: 但し、摂津渡辺党の一つである遠藤氏は式家の後裔を称した。
sen.e: Endo family, one of the lines of Settsu Watanabe-to Party, represented themselves as descendant of Fujiwara Shikike.
However, Endo family, one of the lines of Settsu Watanabe-to Party, represented themselves as descendant of Fujiwara Shikike.
However, Endo family, one of the lines of Settsu Watanabe-to Party, represented themselves as descendant of Fujiwara Shikike.

sen.j: 藤原宇合 - 藤原不比等の三男。
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Umakai was the third son of FUJIWARA no Fuhito.
FUJIWARA no Umakai: The third son of FUJIWARA no Fuhito.

sen.e: FUJIWARA no Umakai: The third son of FUJIWARA no Fuhito.

sen.j: 式家創立者。
sen.e: Umakai was the founder of Fujiwara Shikike.
He was the founder of Fujiwara Shikike.
sen.cmt: 表現を文脈に合うように変更しました。
sen.e: He was the founder of Fujiwara Shikike.

sen.j: 藤原広嗣 - 宇合の長男。
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Hirotsugu was the first son of Umakai.
FUJIWARA no Hirotsugu: The eldest son of Umakai.

sen.j: 北九州で挙兵するも敗死。
sen.e: Hirotsugu raised an army in Kitakyushu, but died in action.
He raised an army in Kitakyushu, but died in action.

sen.j: 内大臣。
sen.e: Yoshitsugu became naidaijin (minister of the center).
He became Naidaijin (minister of the center).

sen.j: 藤原仲麻呂の乱鎮定に功あり。
sen.e: Yoshitsugu won fame in suppressing the Rebellion of Fujiwara no Nakamaro.
He won a fame in suppressing the Rebellion of FUJIWARA no Nakamaro.

sen.j: 藤原百川 - 宇合の八男。

FUJIWARA no Momokawa: The eighth son of Umakai.

sen.j: 光仁朝の権臣。
sen.e: Momokawa was influential vassal during the era of Emperor Konin.
He was an influential vassal during the era of Emperor Konin.

He won a fame in suppressing the Rebellion of FUJIWARA no Nakamaro.

sen.e: He won a fame in suppressing the Rebellion of FUJIWARA no Nakamaro.

sen.j: 藤原乙牟漏 - 良継の娘。
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Otomuro was daughter of FUJIWARA no Yoshitsugu.
FUJIWARA no Otomuro: A daughter of FUJIWARA no Yoshitsugu.
sen.cmt: ハイフン→コロン に変更しました。
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Otomuro: A daughter of FUJIWARA no Yoshitsugu.

sen.j: 桓武天皇皇后｡平城天皇・嵯峨天皇の母。
sen.e: Otomoura was Empress of Emperor Kammu, and was mother of Emperor Heizei and Emperor Saga.
She was Empress of Emperor Kanmu, and the mother of Emperor Heizei and Emperor Saga.
sen.cmt: 表現を文脈に合うように変更しました。
sen.e: She was Empress of Emperor Kanmu, and the mother of Emperor Heizei and Emperor Saga.

sen.j: 藤原人数 - 良継の娘。
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Sanekazu was daughter of Yoshitsugu.
FUJIWARA no Sanekazu: A daughter of Yoshitsugu.
sen.cmt: ハイフン→コロン に変更しました。
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Sanekazu: A daughter of Yoshitsugu.

sen.j: 藤原鷲取室。
sen.e: Sanekazu was wife of FUJIWARA no Washitori.
She was the wife of FUJIWARA no Washitori.
sen.cmt: 表現を文脈に合うように変更しました。
sen.e: She was the wife of FUJIWARA no Washitori.

sen.j: 藤原種継 - 清成の長男。
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Tanetsugu was the first son of Kiyonari.
FUJIWARA no Tanetsugu: The eldest son of Kiyonari.
sen.cmt: ハイフン→コロン に変更しました。
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Tanetsugu: The eldest son of Kiyonari.

sen.j: 長岡京造宮使となるも暗殺される。
sen.e: Tanetsugu was appointed to Nagaokakyo zogushi, but wasmurdered.
He was appointed to Nagaoka-kyo zogushi (construction officer of Nagaoka-kyo) but was murdered.
sen.cmt: 表現を文脈に合うように変更しました。
sen.e: He was appointed to Nagaoka-kyo zogushi (construction officer of Nagaoka-kyo) but was murdered.

sen.j: 藤原正子 - 清成の娘。
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Masako was daughter of Kiyonari.
FUJIWARA no Masako: A daughter of Kiyonari.
sen.cmt: ハイフン→コロン に変更しました。
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Masako: A daughter of Kiyonari.

sen.j: 桓武天皇後宮。
sen.e: Masako was consort of Emperor Kammu.
She was a consort of Emperor Kanmu.
sen.cmt: 表現を文脈に合うように変更しました。
sen.e: She was a consort of Emperor Kanmu.

sen.j: 藤原仲成 - 種継の次男。
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Nakanari was the second son of FUJIWARA no Tanetsugu.
FUJIWARA no Nakanari: The second son of Tanetsugu.
sen.cmt: ハイフン→コロン に変更しました。
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Nakanari: The second son of Tanetsugu.

sen.j: 「薬子の変」で敗死。
sen.e: Nakanari died in the action during the Kusuko Incident.
He died in the action during the 'Kusuko Incident.'
sen.cmt: 表現を文脈に合うように変更しました。
sen.e: He died in the action during the 'Kusuko Incident.'

sen.j: 藤原薬子 - 種継の娘。
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Kusuko was daughter of Tanetsugu.
FUJIWARA no Kusuko: A daughter of Tanetsugu.
sen.cmt: ハイフン→コロン に変更しました。
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Kusuko: A daughter of Tanetsugu.

sen.j: 「薬子の変」の中心人物。
sen.e: Kusuko was the core person of the Kusuko Incident.
She was the core person of the 'Kusuko Incident.'
sen.cmt: 表現を文脈に合うように変更しました。
sen.e: She was the core person of the 'Kusuko Incident.'

sen.j: 藤原緒嗣 - 百川の長男。
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Otsugu was the first son of FUJIWARA no Momokawa.

sen.cmt: ハイフン→コロン に変更しました。
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Otsugu: The eldest son of Momokawa.

sen.j: 左大臣。
sen.e: Otsugu became Sadaijin (Minister of the left).
He was Sadaijin (Minister of the left).
sen.cmt: 表現を文脈に合うように変更しました。
sen.e: He was Sadaijin (Minister of the left).

sen.j: 藤原旅子 - 百川の娘。
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Tabiko was Momokawa's daughter.
FUJIWARA no Tabiko: Momokawa's daughter.

sen.e: Tabiko was consort of Emperor Kammu.

sen.cmt: 表現を文脈に合うように変更しました。
sen.e: She was a consort of Emperor Kanmu.

sen.j: 淳和天皇の母。
sen.e: Tabiko was mother of Emperor Junna.
And the mother of Emperor Junna.
sen.cmt: 表現を文脈に合うように変更しました。
sen.e: And the mother of Emperor Junna.

sen.j: 藤原縄主 - 蔵下麻呂の子。
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Tadanushi was a child of FUJIWARA no Kurajimaro.

sen.cmt: ハイフン→コロン に変更しました。
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Tadanushi: A child of FUJIWARA no Kurajimaro.

sen.j: 薬子の夫。
sen.e: Tadanushi was husband of Kusuko.
He was the husband of Kusuko.
sen.cmt: 表現を文脈に合うように変更しました。
sen.e: He was the husband of Kusuko.

sen.j: 藤原吉野 - 蔵下麻呂の孫。
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Yoshino was grandchild of FUJIWARA no Kurajimaro.
FUJIWARA no Yoshino: A grandchild of Kurajimaro.
sen.cmt: ハイフン→コロン に変更しました。
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Yoshino: A grandchild of Kurajimaro.

sen.j: 承和の変で失脚。
sen.e: Yoshino fell down in the Jowa Incident.
He fell down in the Jowa Incident.
sen.cmt: 表現を文脈に合うように変更しました。
sen.e: He fell down in the Jowa Incident.

sen.j: 藤原元利万呂 - 種継の孫。

sen.cmt: ハイフン→コロン に変更しました。
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Genrimaro: A grandchild of Tanetsugu.

sen.cmt: ハイフン→コロン に変更しました。
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Sukeyo: A great-grandchild of Tanetsugu.

sen.j: 儒学者。
sen.e: Sukeyo was a Confucian scholar.
He was a Confucian scholar.
sen.cmt: 表現を文脈に合うように変更しました。
sen.e: He was a Confucian scholar.

sen.j: 「阿衡の紛議」で著名。
sen.e: Sukeyo was well-known person by the Ako Controversy.
Well-known by the 'Ako Controversy.'
sen.cmt: 表現を文脈に合うように変更しました。
sen.e: Well-known by the 'Ako Controversy.'

sen.j: 藤原忠文 - 緒嗣の曾孫。
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Tadabumi was a great-grandchild of Otsugu.

sen.cmt: ハイフン→コロン に変更しました。
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Tadabumi: A great-grandchild of Otsugu.

sen.j: 征東大将軍。
sen.e: Tadabumi was seito taishogun (literally, "great general who subdues the eastern barbarians").
He became Seito taishogun (literally, "great general who subdues the eastern barbarians").
sen.cmt: 表現を文脈に合うように変更しました。
sen.e: He became Seito taishogun (literally, "great general who subdues the eastern barbarians").

sen.e: FUJIWARA no Nochio was grandchild of Sukeyo.

sen.cmt: ハイフン→コロン に変更しました。
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Nochio: A grandchild of Sukeyo.

sen.j: 歌人、漢詩人。
sen.e: Nochio was kajin (waka poet) as well as a composer of Chinese poems.
He was a waka poet as well as a composer of Chinese poems.
sen.cmt: 表現を文脈に合うように変更しました。
sen.e: He was a waka poet as well as a composer of Chinese poems.

sen.j: 藤原仲文 - 蔵下麻呂の末裔。
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Nakafumi was a descendant of Kurajimaro.

sen.j: 歌人。
sen.e: Nakafumi was kajin (waka poet).
He was a waka poet.
sen.cmt: 表現を文脈に合うように変更しました。
sen.e: He was a waka poet.

sen.j: 頼豪 - 清成の末裔に当たる天台宗の僧。
sen.e: Raigo was a monk of Tendai sect, and a descendant of Kiyonari.
Raigo: A monk of Tendai sect, and a descendant of Kiyonari.
sen.cmt: ハイフン→コロン に変更しました。
sen.e: Raigo: A monk of Tendai sect, and a descendant of Kiyonari.

sen.j: 怨霊伝説で知られる。
sen.e: Raigo was known for a legend of a vengeful spirit (vindictive ghost).
He was known for a legend of a vengeful spirit (vindictive ghost).
sen.cmt: 表現を文脈に合うように変更しました。
sen.e: He was known for a legend of a vengeful spirit (vindictive ghost).

sen.j: 藤原明衡 - 蔵下麻呂の末裔。
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Akihira was a descendant of Kurajimaro.
FUJIWARA no Akihira: A descendant of Kurajimaro.
sen.cmt: ハイフン→コロン に変更しました。
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Akihira: A descendant of Kurajimaro.

sen.j: 儒学者、漢詩人。
sen.e: Akihira was a Confucian scholar and a composer of Chinese poems.
He was a Confucian scholar and a composer of Chinese poems.
sen.cmt: 表現を文脈に合うように変更しました。
sen.e: He was a Confucian scholar and a composer of Chinese poems.

sen.j: 『本朝文粋』編者。
sen.e: Akihira was also editor of "Honcho monzui"(Anthology of waka poems and prose written in classical Chinese).
An editor of "Honcho monzui" (Anthology of waka poems and prose written in classical Chinese).
sen.cmt: 表現を文脈に合うように変更しました。
sen.e: An editor of "Honcho monzui" (Anthology of waka poems and prose written in classical Chinese).

sen.j: 『明衡往来』『新猿楽記』の作者。
sen.e: Akihira wrote Meigo Orai (Meigo's Correspondence) and "Shin sarugoki."
Also an author of "Meigo Orai" (Meigo's Correspondence) and "Shinsarugoki" (a kind of textbook about manners and cultures of Kyoto in Heian period).
sen.cmt: 表現を文脈に合うように変更しました。
sen.e: Also an author of "Meigo Orai" (Meigo's Correspondence) and "Shinsarugoki" (a kind of textbook about manners and cultures of Kyoto in Heian period).

sen.cmt: ハイフン→コロン に変更しました。

sen.cmt: 表現を文脈に合うように変更しました。
sen.e: He was a Confucian scholar and a composer of Chinese poems.
